Ultimately, this crisis demonstrates that America's energy independence is critical to our national security—and it can't be accomplished by increased domestic oil production alone.

We must double-down on efforts to more efficiently use oil, and use more clean, renewable energy.
But rather than turning from one brutal authoritarian regime to another to satisfy demand, America’s domestic energy producers have an obligation to increase supply above pre-pandemic levels.
If energy producers produced at the level before the pandemic today, it would more than make up for what the U.S. had imported from Russia.

A ban on U.S. imports of Russian oil is the right move. 

We must continue to put a squeeze on Russia’s economy and limit Vladimir Putin’s ability to wage this unprovoked and unjustified war on the Ukrainian people.

(1/5)
We have the existing infrastructure—and oil and gas companies shouldn't exploit this crisis to keep production artificially low, hike prices and add to their record profits.
